title: CyTOF protocol for immune monitoring of solid tumors from mouse models
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Section 1: CyTOF for tumors
Timing: 6–7 h
CyTOF for tumors—Live/dead staining
Timing: 1 h
The quality and consistency of samples should be ensured to secure a uniform staining environment. After tumors have been dissociated into single cells, the cells go through a series of washes. Reagents such as EDTA are added during the initial steps after plating to avoid clumping of the cells. In this example, Cell-ID™ Cisplatin is added to the sample as a live/dead stain to properly remove dead cells from downstream analysis. The Cell-ID™ Cisplatin reagent may require a titration experiment for optimal live/dead discrimination. Alternative reagents, e.g., palladium isotopes, may be used for live/dead discrimination. However, when planning, it is important to select non-overlapping channels to be used for live/dead, barcoding, and Cell-ID™ staining. Timely addition of complete RPMI media is important for quenching excess reagent. For studies that require tumor retrieval and CyTOF staining of samples on different days, see problem 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec8.1].
Pipette at least 1.5 million cells from each individual sample onto each well of a U-bottom 96-microwell plate.
Centrifuge plate at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Note: After the first plating from the TIL, at minimum/average 2 washes are encouraged. Pellets should appear as below:
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2289-Fx4.jpg
Note: For steps using microwell plates, we recommend using a multichannel pipette and reagent boats to facilitate the workflow.
Wash cells with 200 μL of 2 mM EDTA per well, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash cells with 250 μL of Maxpar® PBS per well.
Resuspend cells in 50 μL/well of 20 μM Pt (1:500) in Maxpar® PBS.
Incubate the plate for 2.5 min at 25°C.

Promptly quench excess reagent by directly adding 150 μL/well complete RPMI, centrifuge plate at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash cells in 200 μL of Maxpar® CSB, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Repeat the wash step two more times for a total of 3 Maxpar® CSB washes.
Carefully pipette off the residual supernatant off the side of each well without perturbing the cell pellets.
CyTOF for tumors—Barcode stain and batching
Timing: ∼1 h
Upon completion of live/dead labeling, cells will be barcoded by surface epitopes, e.g., CD45, CD98, CD29, followed by batching of samples into multiplexed tubes. This improves the efficiency of the workflow while minimizing antibody consumption and batch effects.
Add barcode stain 75 μL/well, gently resuspend to mix.
Incubate the plate for 25 min at 25°C.
Add 150 μL/well of Maxpar® CSB to the samples, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Resuspend with 200 μL/well of Maxpar® CSB to wash, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Repeat wash step.
Combine well contents into multiplex tubes (VWR® Culture Tubes – Polypropylene, 4.5 mL).
For each multiplex batch, use 300 μL Maxpar® CSB to mix and pipette transfer from one well to the next, combining directly all wells that will be batched into one tube.
Pipette well mixture into multiplex tubes through a 40 μm filter cap.
Repeat this at least two more times for a total of 900 μL for transferring for each tube.
Centrifuge the multiplexed tubes at 500 g for 5 min, decant supernatant, and pipette off residual volume.
Critical: Pipetting off any residual supernatant after decanting helps to ensure that antibody concentrations are not inadvertently diluted down.
CyTOF for tumors—Fc receptor block and surface stain

Timing: ∼1 h
The Fc receptor block is first added to reduce nonspecific binding of the Fc sites on antibodies. The staining cocktail of antibodies against surface epitopes is then added directly onto the samples.
Resuspend cells in calculated volume of Fc block stain.
For calculations, refer to ‘Reagent Preparation for CyTOF – Tumors’.
Incubate tubes for 10 min at 25°C.
Add in the calculated volume of Surface Stain Cocktail.
Incubate tubes for 30 min at 25°C.
Add 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/tube, centrifuge tubes at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash samples in 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/tube, centrifuge tubes at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant off, then pipette off residual.
Optional: since tumor dissociation can be lengthy, cells can be fixed and stored in 1.6% PFA in Maxpar™ PBS for a maximum of 20 h at 4°C with stability.
CyTOF for tumors—Fix/perm for intracellular staining
Timing: 1.5 h
The fix/perm step first fixes the cells and utilizes detergent-based permeabilization buffers to enable staining of the intracellular and intranuclear epitopes. All centrifugation steps are at 700 g instead of 500 g after fixation. An additional fixation step with a freshly made PFA solution is carried out at the end of all staining steps to ensure stability of the stained samples.
Resuspend cells in 300 μL/tube of eBio™ Fix/Perm.
Incubate for 30 min at 25°C.
Add to samples 1 mL of perm buffer/tube, spin at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash samples with 1 mL of perm buffer/tube, spin at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant the supernatant and pipette residual volume off.
Resuspend cells in calculated volume of intracellular stain.
Incubate for 30 min at 25°C.

Add to samples 1 mL of perm buffer/tube, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash samples in 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/tube, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant, then pipette any residual volume off.
Resuspend cells in 400 μL/tube of 1.6% PFA in Maxpar® PBS, and fix for 10 min at 25°C if planning to proceed immediately to ‘CyTOF for Tumors – Rh Staining + Cell Counting[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec4.1.5]’.
Optional: can be stored in 1.6% PFA in Maxpar® PBS up to 1 week at 4°C with stability.
CyTOF for tumors—Rh staining + cell counting
Timing: ∼1–2 h
The Rh stain, a DNA Intercalator, is used to recognize nucleated cell events during analysis. As discussed above, it is important to choose the Cell-ID™ carefully as some commonly used barcoding methods and live/dead assays can overlap in signal. For this protocol, we recommend avoiding live/dead assays with lower metal channels (such as 102–110Pd), as they would overlap in signal with the custom barcodes (metal channels 112–116) utilized in tumor CyTOF. Alternative Cell-ID™ metals for this barcoding scheme include iridium (191/193) and cisplatinum (194–198). The final cell count is critical for estimating the cell yield at the end of the data acquisition.
Centrifuge tubes at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant the supernatant, pipette residual volume off.
Resuspend cells in 300 μL/tube of Rh, incubate for 30 min to 1 h at 25°C.
Add to samples 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/tube.
Do a final cell count for each tube after resuspending in Maxpar® CSB.
Centrifuge tubes at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.

Repeat wash, after decanting, vortex tubes for 2–3 s to resuspend cells in residual volume, Store tubes at 4°C until data acquisition; Rh stain will be stable for 2–3 days in 4°C.

Figure 1. Gating scheme used for demonstrating expected outcomes from mouse tumor immunoprofiling
Sequential gating is performed to identify CD4+ T cells, CD8+ T cells (PD1- and PD1+). Continued subsequent gating identifies B220+CD19+ B cells, NK1.1+ NK cells, F4/80+CD11b+ macrophages, Ly6C+ monocytic myeloid-derived suppressor cells, and Ly6G+ granulocytic myeloid-derived suppressor cells.
Note: For visualization of a stable Rh stain, see Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1].
Section 2: CyTOF for whole blood
Timing: 6–7 h
CyTOF for whole blood—Bleeding
Timing: 10 min
It is imperative to work quickly with fresh blood. Although the blood collection tube will come pre-coated with an anticoagulant, it is recommended to shake the tube after collection so that the blood can be mixed well with anticoagulant as much as possible. We recommend the Microvette K3EDTA collection tube (Cat: 102971-718, VWR). Additional EDTA is mixed to further prevent cell clumping.
Blood collection, as described in above section [Example protocol for survival blood collection.
Just prior to staining, pipette 90 μL blood from the collection tube into a deep-well 96-well plate with pre-aliquoted 10 μL of 0.5 M EDTA and mix well.
Proceed immediately to Fc receptor block and surface stain.
Note: We generally skip initial cell counting step or any other preprocessing methods, e.g., ACK lysis of red blood cells or live-cell barcoding for multiplexing of samples prior to staining, to avoid sample loss. We have expected cell yields from a 100–200 μL volume of blood based on prior experience. See below in Expected Outcomes.
CyTOF for whole blood—Fc receptor block, surface stain, fix/lyse
Timing: 1 h 15 min

The Fc receptor block is first added to reduce nonspecific binding of the Fc sites on antibodies. The staining cocktail of antibodies against surface epitopes is then added directly onto the samples. Since the staining occurs prior to multiplexing in this protocol, the use of a multichannel pipette is recommended. If the study involves assaying of time-sensitive antigens, e.g., phospho-epitopes, prompt fixation of blood samples followed by staining is recommended. However, the antibody panel must be tested to ensure that the antigens of interest are detectable post-fixation with the antibody clones used in the panel.
Pipette 2 μL of stock Fc receptor block directly into wells and mix.
Incubate for 10 min at 25°C.
Add 48 μL surface stain solution into the wells and mix, incubate for 30 min at 25°C.
Add to samples 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/well, centrifuge plate at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Resuspend cells in 100 μL of Maxpar® CSB.
Pipette 2 mL of pre-warmed 1× BD Phosflow™ Fix/Lyse in each well.
Incubate plate in a 37°C water bath for 15 min, centrifuge plate at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Note: Make sure red blood cells have fully lysed before moving onto the next step. For additional details see problem 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec8.9].
Wash cells in 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/well, centrifuge plate at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
If skipping intracellular stain, incubate in 400 μL/well of 1.6% PFA in Maxpar® PBS for 10 min at 4°C.
Optional: can store at 4°C for a maximum of 20 h prior to intracellular staining.
CyTOF for whole blood—Fix/perm for intracellular stain (optional)
Timing: ∼1.5 h

The fix/perm step first fixes the cells and utilizes detergent-based permeabilization buffers to enable staining of the intracellular and intranuclear epitopes. An additional fixation step with a freshly made PFA solution is carried out at the end of all staining steps to ensure stability of the stained samples.
Resuspend cells in 300 μL/well of eBio™ Fix/Perm.
Incubate for 30 min at 25°C.
Add to samples 1 mL of perm buffer/well, spin at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash samples with 1 mL of perm buffer/well, spin at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant the supernatant and pipette residual volume off.
Resuspend cells in calculated volume of intracellular stain.
Incubate for 30 min at 25°C.
Add to samples 1 mL of perm buffer/well, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash samples in 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/well, centrifuge at 500 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant, then pipette any residual volume off.
Resuspend cells in 400 μL/well of 1.6% PFA in Maxpar® PBS, and fix for 10 min at 25°C if planning to proceed immediately to ‘CyTOF for Whole Blood – Barcode Stain and Batching’.
Optional: can be stored in 1.6% PFA in Maxpar® PBS up to 1 week at 4°C with stability.
CyTOF for whole blood—Barcode stain and batching
Timing: ∼1.5 h
Since the cell numbers from mouse survival bleeding samples are generally low, we modify the manufacturer’s protocol for barcoding using the 20-plex Pd Barcoding Kit. For detailed manufacturer’s information on the kit, refer to the Cell-ID 20-Plex Pd Barcoding Kit User Guide[href=https://assets.fluidigm.com/asset/692].
Centrifuge samples at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant carefully, vortex gently.
Resuspend each well in 250 μL of 1× Barcode Perm Buffer.

Thaw the stock tubes containing desired barcodes from the 20-Plex Pd Barcoding Kit, spin in minicentrifuge for 10 s.
Directly add 7 μL of the thawed barcode into each of the wells, incubate samples for 30 min at 25°C.
Centrifuge samples at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant carefully.
Wash with 2 mL of Maxpar® CSB/well, centrifuge plate at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant carefully.
Repeat wash.
Combine well contents into multiplex tubes (VWR® Culture Tubes – Polypropylene, 4.5 mL).
For each multiplex batch, use 300 μL Maxpar® CSB to mix and pipette transfer from one well to the next, combining directly all wells that will be batched into one tube.
Pipette well mixture into multiplex tubes through a 40 μm filter cap.
Repeat this at least two more times for a total of 900 μL for transferring for each tube.
Centrifuge tubes at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
CyTOF for whole blood—Ir staining + cell counting
Timing: ∼1–2 h
The Ir stain, a DNA Intercalator, is used to recognize nucleated cell events during analysis. As discussed above, it is important to choose the Cell-ID™ carefully as some commonly used barcoding methods and live/dead assays can overlap in signal. In this protocol for whole blood staining where Pd is used for barcoding (102, 104, 105, 106, 108–110), Ir (191/193) is selected instead of Rh (103). For low cell count recovery in survival whole blood samples, see problem 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec8.3].
Centrifuge tubes at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant the supernatant, pipette residual volume off.
Resuspend cells in 300 μL/tube of working Cell-ID™ Ir solution (1:3000 in Maxpar® Fix/Perm solution), incubate for 30 min.
Add to samples 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/tube.

Do a final cell count using trypan blue.
Centrifuge tubes at 700 g for 5 min at 25°C, decant supernatant.
Wash using 1 mL of Maxpar® CSB/tube, after decanting, vortex tubes for 2–3 s to resuspend cells in residual volume, Store tubes at 4°C until data acquisition.
